title: A Boston crypt tour now features a stolen ‘Cursed Brick,’ mailed back after ‘a string of bad luck’
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel Guided After-Hours Crypt Tours at Old North Church begin Sept.
The Cursed Brick, part of the After-Hours Crypt Tours at Old North Church.

title: Man pleads not guilty to shooting Boston police officer during Roxbury chase
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Shot multiple times during Friday’s chaotic incident, Daiquan Rice was ordered held without bail pending a dangerousness hearing.

David L Ryan/The Boston Globe By Abby Patkin September 15, 2025 | 4:02 PM 1 minute to read A man accused of shooting a Boston police officer during an early-morning foot chase in Roxbury last week was ordered held without bail following his arraignment Monday.

Shot multiple times during Friday’s chaotic incident, 31-year-old Daiquan Rice pleaded not guilty to a slew of charges that included attempted murder, possession of a Class B drug, and numerous firearms offenses.

title: ‘Super Troopers’ stars take a break from filming sequel to visit Fenway Park
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Stars of the upcoming "Super Troopers 3" movie watched the Red Sox beat the Yankee at Fenway Park on Sunday.
"Super Troopers 3" actors Steve Lemme, Kevin Heffernan, Nat Faxon, Paul Soter, and Jay Chandrasekhar took a break from filming to watch the Red Sox at Fenway Park on Sunday, Sept.

title: Publications and Presentations on a Resume
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Job Doc Pattie Hunt Sinacole provides advice Q: As a health care analyst, I have been fortunate enough to be asked to contribute to several articles.
I also have presented at a well-attended conference.
I have been asked to be “quoted” based on my areas of expertise.

title: Perfect ‘Sense’: Jerry Harrison of Talking Heads brings the band’s classic concert film to Beverly Sunday
author: Blake Maddux
bullets: Music "I think that there are a number of reasons why it has stood the test of time," says Harrison, who will host the screening.
Jerry Harrison — here with Chris Frantz in a scene from “Stop Making Sense” — will be in Beverly to screen and discuss the film this weekend.
Jordan Cronenweth/A24 By Blake Maddux September 15, 2025 | 2:10 PM 6 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Boston officer who testified about ‘false memory’ in Karen Read case resigns
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Officer Kelly Dever had been on family medical leave since earlier in the summer.
Boston Police Officer Kelly Dever, formerly with Canton police, testifies.

Pat Greenhouse / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin September 15, 2025 | 1:52 PM 3 minutes to read A Boston police officer who squared off with Karen Read’s lawyers over claims of a “false memory” has resigned, the department confirmed.

title: Review & setlist: At Roadrunner, Wet Leg must have been kidding. Or maybe not?
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews Regardless, the up-and-coming alt rockers showed a devastating confidence during their second trip to Boston.
Rhian Teasdale brought her band Wet Leg, here at this past summer's Glastonbury Festival in the UK, to Roadrunner Sunday.
Leon Neal/Getty Images By Marc Hirsh September 15, 2025 | 1:05 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: USA Today just named the 10 best supermarket chains — and none of them are Market Basket
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News "There are hundreds of grocery store chains across the United States, but some of them are more beloved than others.
" Customers leave an Aldi supermarket in 2024.
Bloomberg USA Today’s recently announced list of the 10 best supermarket chains didn’t include notable New England favorites such as Market Basket.

title: Mass. district suspends 2nd educator over Charlie Kirk comments
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Overall, at least three school districts in the state are reviewing social media posts from employees following Kirk's public assassination.
People hold candles and sing during a memorial and prayer vigil for Charlie Kirk at the John F.
Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts, Sunday, Sept.

title: Revolution fire head coach Caleb Porter
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution New England suffered losing seasons in both years of Porter's tenure.
The Revolution announced on Monday that it had "parted ways" with head coach Caleb Porter.
Maddie Meyer/Getty Images By Hayden Bird September 15, 2025 | 12:33 PM 1 minute to read Caleb Porter is out as head coach of the Revolution.
